Article 3.Governing Law

This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Japan.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 3.Governing Law

This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of North Korea.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the governing law to North Korea would introduce a legal contradiction, as it would be extremely difficult, if not impossible, to enforce the agreement under North Korean law due to international sanctions, lack of legal transparency, and fundamentally different legal and business practices. Contracts are generally governed by jurisdictions where parties have connections or where business activity takes place.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of Contract Law and International Law

perturbation.original_text: d.Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: d.Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the clause to release parties from liability for breaches prior to closing introduces a legal contradiction. Generally, parties remain liable for breaches of contract that occurred before the termination or amendment of the agreement. Releasing liability retroactively could conflict with established contract law principles regarding vested rights and obligations.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of Contract Law regarding liability for breach.

perturbation.original_text:
Article 2.D&O Indemnity

Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text:
Article 2.D&O Indemnity

Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable. The Nissin Parties' obligation to provide indemnification will cease in one (1) week from the VNBZ Closing.
perturbation.explanation: The added sentence imposes an unreasonably short period of one week for D&O Indemnity, which typically requires a longer timeframe to address potential liabilities. This conflicts with typical Indemnity clauses in commercial contracts and could lead to unenforceability due to its restrictiveness and lack of commercial reasonableness.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General principles of Contract Law regarding Indemnity.
